title: Ticket #2258: Use autocluster size to limit matchlist
description: autocluster size can be used to limit matchlist. There is no reason to build matchlist when autocluster size is 1. Similarly, the size of matchlist can be limited to autocluster size.
remarks:
2012-Dec-17 11:23:29 by tannenba:
What is the motivation here? Does doing what is suggested above actually result in any significant time or memory savings on a negotiation cycle? No before/after performance results are reported. At first blush from the description, seems like it may just be adding complication/code for an insignificant speedup. Would love to be proved wrong, but until such time I am going to mark this ticket as abandoned.

The attached patch is not a patch file btw, it is html.
attachments:
• machlist.patch 61640 bytes added by jrt on 2011-Jun-21 17:04:33 UTC.
    beta version of patch.

    The patch adds a size_array to manage size information in the autocluster class. The size information is attached to the request ad during negotiation and sent to the negotiator. If size == 1 matchlist is not built. Otherwise size of matchlist is limited by the size of the autocluster
